p: It is one of the most utilized fruits by livestock herders, children, women, and the poorest families. Its main utilization is as a food and some amount sold in the roads and local markets [ 17]. In different parts of Ethiopia, the leaf is highly important as a feed for cattle, goats, and sheep. The plant is available in all months of the year as it is not a deciduous plant. Hence, its leaf is available in all months of the year as a feed for animals [ 50]. In Tsemay and Benna ethnic groups of the country, the plant is reported to have a supplementary role as a household food security [ 51].
